answers.answer: Hi,Thanks for writing in.Your symptoms are suggestive of peripheral neuropathy which can be due to diabetes or Vitamin B12 deficiency. Please get yourself tested for diabetes. You can also take OTC B12 supplements and see if they help.If there is no improvement in your symptoms please consult a neurologist. Hope this helps!

question: I've had a constant burning sensation behind one knee for more than a month. I consulted a dermatologist who found nothing wrong with my skin and dx'd it as parestesia. I've now had burning sensation on top of tongue for about a week. Any idea what might be causing this? (I am looking for a neurologist in my insurance program).  thank you.
title: parestesia in back of knee and on tongue
